The Ultimate Reimbursement Guide (Using Keyboard as Example)

A practical guide to efficiently process reimbursements

ğŸš€ Quick Reimbursement Guide

This guide provides a streamlined approach to handling reimbursements for your Innovation and Entrepreneurship Training Program project. Follow these steps to ensure your reimbursement claims are processed quickly and accurately.

ğŸ“‹ Reimbursement Process Overview

The table below outlines the entire reimbursement process, with each step detailed in the Detailed Steps section:

No.ActionDetailsDetailed Section
1ï¸âƒ£Purchase itemsPreferably under 300 yuan each; items over 300 yuan must be listed as fixed assetsInvoice Guide
2ï¸âƒ£Obtain valid invoicesGet official invoices with the university nameInvoice Guide
3ï¸âƒ£Register in systemRecord reimbursement order in finance platform and verify invoicesStep 1
4ï¸âƒ£Prepare materialsAssemble required documents based on reimbursement typeStep 2
5ï¸âƒ£Organize documentsAttach invoices and sign relevant materialsStep 3
6ï¸âƒ£Submit materialsSubmit to Room 1A208, Administration BuildingStep 4
7ï¸âƒ£Track progressRegularly check reimbursement statusStep 5

ğŸ“‘ Invoice Guide

This section corresponds to steps 1ï¸âƒ£ and 2ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: purchasing items and obtaining valid invoices

Invoicing generally falls into two categories: obtaining invoices before purchase and obtaining invoices after purchase.

Obtaining Invoices Before Purchase

Using JD.com as an example, follow these steps:

  1. Find the Invoice Information option at the bottom of the payment page

  2. Select "Electronic Invoice" and fill in the invoice information:

    • Invoice title: Select "Unit" and enter the full name of the university (Dongguan University of Technology)
    • Invoice content: Select "Product Category" (recommended) or "Details"
    • Click submit order after completion

ğŸ’¼ University Invoice Information:

ItemContent
Institution Nameä¸œèç†å·¥å­¦é™¢

âš ï¸ Important Notes:

  • ğŸ’¼ Invoice Type Restrictions: Shenzhen VAT invoices and Zhejiang invoices typically cannot be reimbursed through normal procedures. Ask vendors to issue standard VAT invoices whenever possible; consult your advisor if there are difficulties.
  • ğŸ” Invoice Content Selection: Prioritize "Product Category" over "Product Details." During financial review, category descriptions are generally easier to get approved.
  • âœ… Invoice Verification: After the vendor ships, you can download and print the electronic invoice from the order details. Ensure the university name is clearly displayed on the invoice.

Obtaining Invoices After Purchase

If you've already made a purchase without proper invoicing, you can request supplementary invoices:

  1. Find the after-sales service or invoice option on your order details page

  2. Select "Apply for Invoice" or "Change Invoice", and follow the prompts

Retrieving Electronic Invoices

Steps for retrieving electronic invoices:

  1. Open the order details page
  2. Click "More" â†’ "View Invoice"
  3. Click the "Send to Email" button in the bottom right
  4. The system will send a PDF version of the invoice to your specified email

ğŸ§¾ Detailed Reimbursement Steps

Based on the Process Overview above, here are detailed instructions for each step:

1ï¸âƒ£ Register Reimbursement in Finance Platform

Corresponds to step 3ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: Register in system

This process includes two payment methods: personal transfer and corporate transfer. Follow these steps:

  1. Access the One-Stop Service System: ğŸ”— https://ywtb.dgut.edu.cn/custom/index.html#/

  2. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click System Express-Finance Platform

  3. In the Finance Platform, click Smart Reimbursement-Appointment Reimbursement in the sidebar to enter the online self-service accounting platform

  4. Click Routine Reimbursement to enter the routine reimbursement list

  5. Click New Business Registration in the upper right corner of the routine reimbursement list

  6. Click the question mark icon to the right of the text input box next to Project Number on the new business registration page

  7. Select the project number to be reimbursed in the pop-up window; related fields will be automatically populated

  8. Click Next Step (Reimbursement Expense Details)

  9. Fill in expense details - recommend using the following categories (verified to pass audit):

    • âœ… Office Expenses-Office Supplies
    • âœ… Specialized Material Fees-Experimental Materials

    ğŸ’¡ Selection Standard: Consider ease of evidence collection and financial audit difficulty

  10. Click Next Step (Payment Method)

  11. Click Verify Invoice on the payment information entry page

    âš ï¸ If you encounter verification issues, check if your browser has blocking plugins enabled

  12. Fill in the payment method (corporate or personal transfer)

    Note: System entry is the same, the difference is in subsequent material submission requirements

2ï¸âƒ£ Prepare Reimbursement Materials

Corresponds to step 4ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: Prepare materials

Required materials differ depending on the payment method:

ğŸ“„ Materials Required for Personal Transfer:

  • Routine Reimbursement Form - Form printed after completing the finance platform

  • Electronic Invoice - Printed electronic invoice

  • Payment Proof - Order details screenshot (using JD.com as an example)

ğŸ“„ Materials Required for Corporate Transfer:

  • Routine Reimbursement Form - Same as above

  • Electronic Invoice - Same as above

  • Item List - Must proactively contact the vendor to provide (university pays vendor directly)

3ï¸âƒ£ Organize Reimbursement Materials

Corresponds to step 5ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: Organize documents

  1. Use the Dongguan University of Technology Reimbursement Document Pasting Form[1] to paste invoices

    âš ï¸ Notes:

    • Do not fold or overlap pasted documents
    • Generally, paste only one invoice per pasting form
    • Fill in the number of bills (usually 1) and amount in the upper right corner

    ğŸ“Œ Detailed pasting standards can be found in: Bill Pasting Instructions

  2. Signature Requirements:

    • âœï¸ Handler (system registrant)
    • âœï¸ Project person in charge
    • âœï¸ Faculty advisor

    ğŸ’¡ If the handler is also the project person in charge, signatures are required in both places

    ğŸ“ Signature location: Sign in the blank areas of the document (invoices typically in lower left, attachment sheet above)

4ï¸âƒ£ Submit Reimbursement Materials

Corresponds to step 6ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: Submit materials

  • ğŸ“ Submit organized materials to: Songshan Lake Campus Administration Building, Room 1A208 (Finance Office)

5ï¸âƒ£ Track Reimbursement Progress

Corresponds to step 7ï¸âƒ£ in the overview: Track progress

  • ğŸ”„ Regularly check reimbursement status and processing progress through the finance platform
  • â±ï¸ Allow sufficient processing time, especially before project conclusion

â“ Common Issues and Quick Solutions

Issue: Invoice amount does not match actual payment amount

ğŸ’¡ Solution:

  • Ensure invoice amount matches the actual payment amount
  • Special cases (such as JD.com discounts):
    1. Enter the actual payment amount in the system (not the invoice amount)
    2. Note the reason for the amount difference on the attachment sheet

Issue: Submitted before deadline, but finance audit delayed

ğŸ’¡ Solution:

  • Modifications can be made according to finance audit opinions
  • Must complete submission before Dongguan University of Technology's account closing date

Issue: Finance office returns application

ğŸ’¡ Solution:

  • Carefully read return comments
  • Modify as required and promptly resubmit

ğŸ“ Support Contacts

  • Project Finance Office:
    • ğŸ“ Location: Dongguan University of Technology Songshan Lake Campus Administration Building, Room 1A208
    • â˜ï¸ Phone: (0769) 22861234
    • ğŸ•™ Office Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00-12:00, 14:00-17:00

ğŸ’¼ Remember, following the correct reimbursement procedures will ensure smooth project operation and guarantee that all team members receive their reimbursements in a timely manner.
